title: Monoradar Target Reports Appendix A: Reserved Expansion Field

items.definition: Mode 5 Data/Reports, Extended Mode 1 Code and X pulse.
items.name: MD5
items.remark:
Note:
    In 2011 NATO has modified the format of the National Origin information
    available in subitem 2 of the Mode 5 data item in this Reserved Expansion Field. The
    information for National Origin and Mission Code were combined into a 11-bit long
    field. In order to maintain backwards compatibility and to ease the use of the new
    layout, the original Mode 5 data item was copied and the layout of subitem #2
    adapted. The new layout is reflected in the data item M5N and shall be used by
    equipment prepared for the new National Origin system.
    Equipment certified to the previous encoding shall continue to use the data item MD5
    corresponding to the 5-bit National Origin / 6-bit Mission Code.
items.title: Mode 5 Reports

items.name: SUM
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data items I048/050, I048/070
       and I048/090 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of data item
       I048/055, Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation, and to the contents of the
       Subitem #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation).
    2. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply/report is received with the Emergency bit set,
       then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I048/020, Target Report
       Descriptor, shall be set.
    3. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply/report is received with the Identification of
       Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item
       I048/020, Target Report Descriptor, shall be set.
items.title: Mode 5 Summary

values: Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply/report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode C altitude not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode C altitude from Mode 5 reply/report

items.name: PMN
items.remark:
Note:
    Bit 14 (NAV) is set to 1 if the value for National Origin is not known or invalid.
    Under certain conditions PIN is available but NAT is not available. NAV then
    indicates that the NAT field was not actively populated.
items.title: PIN/ National Origin/Mission Code

items.name: POS
items.remark:
Notes:
    Latitude in WGS 84 is expressed as a 24-bit two’s complement number.
    Range -90° ≤ latitude ≤ 90°. Sign convention: North is positive.
    LSB = 180/223 degrees = 2.145767*10-05 degrees.

    Longitude in WGS 84 is expressed as a 24-bit two’s complement number.
    Range -180° ≤ longitude < 180°. Sign convention: East is positive.
    LSB = 180/223 degrees = 2.145767*10-05 degrees.

    The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5
    position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined
    formats.
items.title: Mode 5 Reported Position

items.description: "Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is reported"
items.name: RES

items.description: "GNSS-derived Altitude of target, expressed as height above WGS 84 ellipsoid"
items.name: GA
EM1
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. If Subitem #1 is present, the M1 bit in Subitem #1 indicates whether the
       Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subitem
       #1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply.
    2. For reasons of backwards compatibility the logic for the setting of the V-bit
       was inverted compared to other similar data items.
    3. The values of the bits for V, G, L, A4, A2, A1, B2 and B1 shall be identical to
       the values of the corresponding bits in data item I048/055.
items.title: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

values: Mode 1 Code derived from the reply of the transponder
Mode 1 Code not extracted during the last scan

items.name: EM1
items.title: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

items.name: TOS
items.remark:
Note:
    TOS shall be assumed to be zero if Subitem #6 is not present.
items.title: Time Offset for POS and GA

items.name: XP
items.remark:
Note:
    Within Mode 5 replies/reports, the X-Pulse can be set for the following cases:
    1. In a combined Mode 1 and Mode 2 reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the X2 bit
       shall be set;
    2. In a combined Mode 3 and Mode C reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the X3 bit
       shall be set;
    3. In a Mode 5 PIN data reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the XP bit shall be set.
    The X1 bit and the XC bit are meaningless as in Mode 1 and Mode C replies/reports
    the X Pulse is not defined. They are kept for compatibility reasons.
items.title: X Pulse Presence

items.name: X5
items.title: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data Reply or Report

values: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

items.definition: Mode 5 Data/Reports, Extended Mode 1 Code and X pulse following the updated NATO format for the National Origin code
items.name: M5N
items.remark:
Note:
    In 2011 NATO has modified the format of the National Origin information
    available in subitem 2 of the Mode 5 data item in this Reserved Expansion Field. The
    information for National Origin and Mission Code were combined into a 11-bit long
    field. In order to maintain backwards compatibility and to ease the use of the new
    layout, the original Mode 5 data item was copied and the layout of subitem #2
    adapted. The new layout is reflected in the data item M5N and shall be used by
    equipment prepared for the new National Origin system.
    Equipment certified to the previous encoding shall continue to use the data item MD5
    corresponding to the 5-bit National Origin / 6-bit Mission Code.
items.title: Mode 5 Reports, New Format

items.name: SUM
items.remark:
Notes:
    4. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data items I048/050, I048/070
       and I048/090 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of data item
       I048/055, Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation, and to the contents of the
       Subitem #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation).
    5. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply/report is received with the Emergency bit set,
       then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I048/020, Target Report
       Descriptor, shall be set.
    6. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply/report is received with the Identification of
       Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item
       I048/020, Target Report Descriptor, shall be set.
items.title: Mode 5 Summary

values: Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply/report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode C altitude not present or not from Mode 5 reply/report
Mode C altitude from Mode 5 reply/report

items.name: PMN
items.remark:
Note:
    Bit 12 (NOV) is set to 1 if the value for National Origin is not known or invalid.
    Under certain conditions PIN is available but NO is not available. NOV then
    indicates that the NO field was not actively populated.
items.title: PIN/ National Origin/Mission Code

items.name: POS
items.remark:
Notes:
    Latitude in WGS 84 is expressed as a 24-bit two’s complement number.
    Range -90° ≤ latitude ≤ 90°. Sign convention: North is positive.
    LSB = 180/223 degrees = 2.145767*10-05 degrees

    Longitude in WGS 84 is expressed as a 24-bit two’s complement number.
    Range -180° ≤ longitude < 180°. Sign convention: East is positive.
    LSB = 180/223 degrees = 2.145767*10-05 degrees

    The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5
    position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined
    formats.
items.title: Mode 5 Reported Position

items.description: Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is reported

items.description: GNSS-derived Altitude of target, expressed as height above WGS 84 ellipsoid

EM1
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. If Subitem #1 is present, the M1 bit in Subitem #1 indicates whether the
       Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subitem
       #1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply.
    2. For reasons of backwards compatibility the logic for the setting of the V-bit
       was inverted compared to other similar data items.
    3. The values of the bits for V, G, L, A4, A2, A1, B2 and B1 shall be identical to
       the values of the corresponding bits in data item I048/055.
items.title: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

items.name: XP
items.remark:
Note:
    Within Mode 5 replies/reports, the X-Pulse can be set for the following cases:
    1. In a combined Mode 1 and Mode 2 reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the X2 bit
       shall be set;
    2. In a combined Mode 3 and Mode C reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the X3 bit
       shall be set;
    3. In a Mode 5 PIN data reply/report: in this case the X5 bit and the XP bit shall be set.
    The X1 bit and the XC bit are meaningless as in Mode 1 and Mode C replies/reports
    the X Pulse is not defined. They are kept for compatibility reasons.
items.title: X Pulse Presence

items.name: X5
items.title: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data Reply or Report

values: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply

items.description: Figure of Merit. Position Accuracy as extracted and provided by a Mode 5 transponder.
items.name: FOM

items.definition: Extended encoding of the Mode 4 interrogation result
items.name: M4E
items.title: Extended Mode 4 Report

items.definition: Extension to data item I048/130 for primary reports
items.name: RPC
items.title: Radar Plot Characteristics

items.description: The score describes the number of raw responses used to create the plot.
items.name: SCO
items.title: Score

items.description:
The Signal / Clutter Ratio describes the difference in signal strength between the
signal constituting the raw plot and the signal of the clutter.
items.name: SRC
items.title: Signal/Clutter Ratio

items.description:
The Range Width defines the difference in range between the closest proximity to the
radar of the raw response and the point farthest away from the radar.
items.name: RW
items.title: Range Width

items.description: The Ambiguous Range describes the Pulse Repetition Interval of the radar in range.
items.name: AR
items.title: Ambiguous Range

items.definition:
Adaptation of data item I048/040 to extended range radars for
provision of the measured range of an aircraft in local polar
coordinates when the range is equal to or greater than 256NM
items.name: ERR
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. For radars with an operational range beyond 256 NM data item I048/040 is
       insufficient. These radars may use this extension to provide the target position
       equal to or beyond 256 NM. In such cases, data item I048/040 shall be
       transmitted in addition to this extension. In this case it is recommended to
       set bits 32/17 in data item I048/040 to “1”.
    2. The Encoding Rule for data item I048/040 still applies.
    3. This item represents the measured target position of the plot, even if
       associated with a track, for the present antenna scan. It is expressed in polar
       co-ordinates in the local reference system, centred on the radar station.
    4. In case of combined detection by a PSR and an SSR, then the SSR position is
       sent.
    5. Before migrating an ASTERIX encoder to Edition 1.10 of this specification,
       care has to be taken that receiving decoders allow the presence of the value
       256 NM in the record. Systems applying a range check may otherwise
       suppress the record.
items.title: Extended Range Report

items.description: Providing link between a track and its associated plot.
items.name: PTL
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. (to bits-16/1): If SCN = 0, PLOTNR shall be set to 0.
    2. (to bit-21): If SCN = 1, I048/020/SCN#VAL – if implemented - shall be set to “1”.
items.title: Plot/Track Link

values: Track is not associated with an SCN Plot
Track is associated with an SCN Plot
Associated Plot does not contain a Roll Call component
Associated Plot contains at least a Roll Call component
Associated Plot does not contain an All Call component
Associated Plot contains at least an All Call component
Associated Plot does not contain an SSR component
Associated Plot contains at least an SSR component
Associated Plot does not contain a PSR component
Associated Plot contains at least a PSR component

items.description: Unique reference to the associated plot record
items.name: PLOTNR

items.description: Providing link between a track and its associated ADS-B Report.
items.name: ATL
items.remark:
Note:
    The presence of this information shall be communicated in Data Item
    I048/020 by setting I048/020/ADSB#VAL – if implemented - = 1.
items.title: ADS-B/Track Link

items.description: Turn State with probability with regards to track evolution hypothesis (Circular model).
items.name: TRN
items.title: Turn State

items.description:
Next predicted position for a track update at the next expected antenna rotation in
reference to the current track update.
items.name: NPP
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. When the area crosses North, THETASTART is larger than THETAEND.
    2. Next detection = Time of Day of current track record + PREDTIME.
items.title: Next Predicted Position

items.description: Active message list for the aircraft for the current scan.
items.name: DLK
items.title: Data Link Characteristics

items.description: Type of Message Protocol
items.name: TYPE

values: Surveillance Mode A (alert bit or periodic)

items.description: Frame Detection
items.name: ORIGIN

values: Requested in the beam by transponder

items.description: Frame state at aircraft release
items.name: STATE

items.description: Lockout State and remaining Lockout Time
items.name: LCK
items.title: Lockout Characteristics

values: Target not locked out by this radar
Target locked out by this radar

items.description: Indication and Counter of Transition Codes for Modes 1, 2, and 3
items.name: TC
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. This item indicates a difference in the value for TCODEX between the code in
       the track file and the code from the latest plot updating the track.
    2. If TCOUNTX is set to 0 then TCODEX is meaningless and all bits shall be set
       to 0.
    3. The meaning of the individual bits in TCODEX is described in ICAO Annex 10
       Volume 4 Chapter 3.1.1.6.2.
items.title: Transition Code

items.description: Number of scans with transient Mode 1 Code
items.name: TCOUNT1

items.description: Transient Mode 1 Code
items.name: TCODE1

items.description: Number of scans with transient Mode 2 Code
items.name: TCOUNT2

items.description: Transient Mode 2 Code
items.name: TCODE2

items.description: Number of scans with transient Mode 3 Code
items.name: TCOUNT3

items.description: Transient Mode 3 Code
items.name: TCODE3

items.description: Acquisition Status of the Track and Track Life Cycle Counters
items.name: TLC
items.remark:
Notes:
    1. When Subitem #8 is included, each element shall be properly populated.
    2. The setting of bits 32/31 is implementation dependent and shall be described
       in the ICD of the system generating the ASTERIX record.
    3. The TRKUPDCTR is initiated with a value of 1 and it is incremented by 1 each
       time a track is updated.
    4. The LASTTRKUPD is set to 0 each time a track is updated.
items.title: Track Life Cycle

items.description: Acquisition Status Indicator
items.name: ACQI

values: Tentative Track with at least Two Plots

items.description: Track Update Counter
items.name: TRKUPDCTR

items.description: Time since last Track Update
items.name: LASTTRKUPD

items.description: Adjacent Sensor information (received via SCN) for the respective Mode S address
items.name: ASI
items.title: Adjacent Sensor Information

items.name: TIMEOFDAYSCN
items.title: Absolute Timestamp in UTC Provided by the SCN

items.description: Duplicate Address Reference Number uniquely identifying the aircraft in case of a duplicate Mode S Address
items.name: DRN

items.description: Source for the extrapolation of the track information
items.name: TES
items.title: Track Extrapolation Source

items.description: Information whether during latest scan the Mode 3/A Code was requested
items.name: IR
items.title: Identity Requested

items.description: Identity Requested during latest scan
items.name: IR

items.definition: Plot Characteristics and Common Characteristics for Plots and Tracks
items.name: CPC
items.title: Common and Plot Characteristics

items.description: Unique reference to a Plot Record
items.name: PNB
items.title: Plot Number

items.description: Link between a Plot and its Replies
items.name: RPL
items.title: Replies/Plot Link

items.description: Unique reference to a plot record
items.name: REPLYNBR

items.description: Scan Number
items.name: SNB
items.remark:
Note:
    The Scan Number ranges from 1 to 127 and is incremented when the radar
    passes North. Once SCANNBR reached 127 it will restarted at 1 with the next
    scan.
items.title: Scan Number

items.description: Current Date in the form YYYYMMDD
items.name: DATE
items.remark:
Note:
    The day is incremented at midnight UTC.
items.title: Common and Plot Characteristics Date

items.description: First digit of year
items.name: Y1

items.description: Second digit of year
items.name: Y2

items.description: Third digit of year
items.name: Y3

items.description: Fourth digit of year
items.name: Y4

items.description: First digit of month
items.name: M1

items.description: Second digit of month
items.name: M2

items.description: First digit of day
items.name: D1
